body:
### Describe the bug

I was helping pyav update to cython 3 https://github.com/PyAV-Org/PyAV/pull/1145

and I hit the following

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```
# activate your dev environment
mamba install cython ffmpeg=5 numpy pytest
git clone git@github.com:hmaarrfk/PyAV.git
cd PyAV
git checkout cython3
pip install -e . -vv --no-build-isolation --no-deps
```

Apply the patch:
```patch
diff --git a/av/video/format.pyx b/av/video/format.pyx
index 9ad5391..b966582 100644
--- a/av/video/format.pyx
+++ b/av/video/format.pyx
@@ -47,14 +47,10 @@ cdef class VideoFormat(object):
         self.ptr = lib.av_pix_fmt_desc_get(pix_fmt)
         self.width = width
         self.height = height
-        # hmaarrfk -- 2023/07/23
-        # Note on tuple([])
-        # Cython 3 seems to have trouble with cdef tuples, so we use a list
-        # it complains about some const identifier not being able to get assigned
-        self.components = tuple([
+        self.components = tuple(
             VideoFormatComponent(self, i)
             for i in range(self.ptr.nb_components)
-        ])
+        )
 
     def __repr__(self):
         if self.width or self.height:
```


```
  /home/mark/mambaforge/envs/dev/bin/x86_64-conda-linux-gnu-cc -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -fPIC -O2 -isystem /home/mark/mambaforge/envs/dev/include -fPIC -O2 -isystem /home/mark/mambaforge/envs/dev/include -march=nocona -mtune=haswell -ftree-vectorize -fPIC -fstack-protector-strong -fno-plt -O2 -ffunction-sections -pipe -isystem /home/mark/mambaforge/envs/dev/include -DNDEBUG -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -O2 -isystem /home/mark/mambaforge/envs/dev/include -fPIC -I/home/mark/mambaforge/envs/dev/include -I/home/mark/mambaforge/envs/dev/include/python3.9 -c src/av/video/format.c -o /tmp/tmpmwp8qucp.build-temp/src/av/video/format.o
  src/av/video/format.c: In function '__pyx_pf_2av_5video_6format_11VideoFormat_5_init_genexpr':
  src/av/video/format.c:3310:40: error: assignment of read-only member '__pyx_genexpr_arg_0'
   3310 |   __pyx_cur_scope->__pyx_genexpr_arg_0 = __pyx_genexpr_arg_0;
        |                          
```

Log and format.c.txt from 3.0.0 but I confirmed that it also occurs in main branch
* [log.txt](https://github.com/cython/cython/files/12139884/log.txt)
* [format.c.txt](https://github.com/cython/cython/files/12139894/format.c.txt)


### Expected behaviour

that it compiles. I worked around it by using a list comprehension before the `tuple` call.

### OS

Linux

### Python version

3.9.16

### Cython version

main or 3.0.0 (conda-forge)

### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG] assignment of read-only member -- occurs with cython tuple optimizations
